templates.chief_complaint: Chief Complaint: Patient presents with persistent headache for 3 days.
templates.history_present_illness: History of Present Illness: 32-year-old woman reports onset of unilateral headache 3 days ago, described as dull and constant pain affecting mainly the right side of the head. Pain intensity rated 6-7/10. Patient reports associated nausea and photophobia. Symptoms are affecting daily activities. No fever reported. Patient notes mild neck stiffness. No visual changes.
templates.systems_review: Review of Systems: Positive for headache, nausea, photophobia, neck stiffness. Negative for fever, visual changes, vomiting.
templates.vital_signs: Vital Signs: Not documented in this encounter
templates.physical_exam: Physical Exam: Not performed in this encounter
templates.virtual_consultation: Note: This was a virtual/telephone consultation focused on taking clinical history.
templates.migraine: 1. Migraine - supported by unilateral location, moderate intensity, associated nausea and photophobia
templates.tension_headache: 2. Tension headache - neck stiffness may suggest muscular component
templates.secondary_headache: 3. Secondary headache - would require additional evaluation if symptoms persist
templates.clinical_impression: Clinical Impression: Patient presents clinical characteristics compatible with primary headache disorder, most likely migraine vs tension headache. No warning symptoms identified.
templates.nsaid_trial: - Trial with NSAIDs (ibuprofen 400mg q6h PRN) for symptomatic relief
templates.triptan_therapy: - Consider triptan therapy if migraine diagnosis is confirmed
templates.rest: - Rest in dark and quiet environment
templates.control_appointment: - Control appointment in 1 week if symptoms persist or worsen
templates.urgent_care: - Immediate medical attention if develops fever, severe neck stiffness or neurological symptoms
templates.triggers: - Discussed headache triggers and lifestyle modifications
templates.urgent_signs: - Provided information about when to seek urgent care
